==Extending the wrapper to Django==

===Templatetage Usage===
*The module contains a template tags extension that functions like this*
{{{
{% load charts %}

{% chart lc GurMrabsClgubaolGvzCrgrefOrnhgvshyvforggregunahtyl  %}
    {% title 'The Zen of Python' 00cc00 36 %}
    {% color 00cc00 %}
{% endchart %} 
}}}
*Which creates and img tag to handle this chart*

http://chart.apis.google.com/chart?chd=s:GurMrabsClgubaolGvzCrgrefOrnhgvshyvforggregunahtyl&chco=00cc00&chts=00cc00,36&chs=300x150&cht=lc&chtt=The+Zen+of+Python&.png

===Installation===

*Just put the charts app in your `INSTALLED_APPS` and add the templates directory in the `TEMPLATE_DIRS` in `settings.py`*

{{{
...
INSTALLED_APPS = (
    'django.contrib.auth',
    'django.contrib.admin',
    ...
    'GChartWrapper.charts',
)

TEMPLATE_DIRS = (
    '/usr/lib/python2.5/site-packages/GChartWrapper/charts/templates',
)
...
}}}
`Replace /usr/lib/python2.5/site-packages with your site package directory as appropriate*`

*Then just place an include in your `urls.py` like so*

{{{
...
    (r'^charts/', include('GChartWrapper.charts.urls')),
...
}}}
